articles.author: Sandra Stojanovic, Omar Younis
articles.description: The protests pit Democratic-run Los Angeles against Trump's Republican White House, which has made cracking down on immigration a hallmark of his second term.
articles.title: Protesters rally against immigration agents for second day in Los Angeles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The 39-year-old senator is a member of the opposition conservative Democratic Center party.
articles.title: Colombia's potential presidential contender Miguel Uribe shot, suspect arrested

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The United States believes that Russian President Vladimir Putin's threatened retaliation against Ukraine over its drone attack last weekend has not happened yet in earnest and is likely to be a significant, multi-pronged strike, U.S. officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: US believes Russia response to Ukraine drone attack not over yet, expects multi-pronged strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian military said Russia launched 206 drones, 2 ballistic and 7 other missiles overnight.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills three, wounds 22, mayor says

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwan's coast guard held drills with the military on Sunday to better practice joint operations in the face of what the government in Taipei says is a growing "grey zone" threat from China, which claims the island as its own territory.
articles.title: Taiwan coast guard, military drill to better face China's 'grey zone' threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ecuador's National Assembly on Saturday approved a reform backed by President Daniel Noboa to arm the government with new legal powers to confront armed groups and dismantle the drug-trafficking networks that fuel their criminal enterprises.
articles.title: Ecuador national assembly passes gang-fighting reforms

articles.author: Sabine Siebold
articles.description: A Ukrainian drone attack last weekend likely damaged around 10% of Russia's strategic bomber fleet and hit some of the aircraft as they were being prepared for strikes on Ukraine, a senior German military official said.
articles.title: Ukrainian attack damaged 10% of Russia's strategic bombers, Germany says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Argentina's President Javier Milei held his first official audience with Pope Leo at the Vatican on Saturday where he confirmed that the pontiff will visit the South American country, according to the presidential spokesman.
articles.title: Milei meets Pope Leo, confirms visit to Argentina

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: The falling-out began brewing days ago when Musk denounced Trump's tax-cut and spending bill.
articles.title: Trump is not interested in talking to Musk as they feud over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Krishna N. Das
articles.description: Britain and India on Saturday discussed expanding their "counter-terrorism" collaboration following recent fighting between India and Pakistan, Britain's foreign minister told Reuters after meeting Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
articles.title: UK and India discuss 'counter-terrorism' cooperation after Pakistan ceasefire
